data.title: John Anderson Barstow MC (1893-1941)
data.meta_description: Is this your ancestor? Explore genealogy for John Barstow MC born 1893 Edinburgh, Edinburghshire, Scotland, United Kingdom died 1941 Duns, Berwickshire, Scotland, United Kingdom including ancestors + descendants + 1 photos + more in the free family tree community.
data.text:
Ancestors Descendants

Problems/Questions

Profile last modified 4 Jul 2024 | Created 29 Oct 2014

This page has been accessed 582 times.

Biography

John Barstow MC is Notable.

John was born in 1893. He was the son of Lieutenant Colonel Thomas Adam Anderson and Jane Cape Barstow.

He joined the British Army and was commissioned as a second lieutenant into the Argyll and Sutherland Highlanders, transferred to the Black Watch (Royal Highlanders) in May 1916, during World War I. He was awarded the Military Cross on 3 June 1916.

He married Nancy Sinclair-Wemyss on 10 June 1919. They had two children.

During the interwar period he served as a staff officer in India and on the Imperial General Staff as well as serving with the 1st Battalion, Black Watch.

During World War Two he commanded the 69th Infantry Brigade.

John passed away in 1941 at the age of 47, soon after leaving command of the 69th Brigade. His final military rank was Acting Brigadier.

Burial

Edrom, Borders, Scotland. Plot: Sec. D.D. Grave 71[1]
